intro: Halimolobos hispidulus var. typicus, commonly known as the rough-hairy halimolobos, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant features hairy, glandular leaves that are typically rough to the touch, contributing to its common name. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, dry fruits known as achenes. This species is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
